DOC.brief_summary: High-volume infiltration analgesia may be effective in postoperative pain management following total hip arthroplasty. In this randomized, double-blind trial patients undergoing bilateral hip arthoplasty are randomized to receive high-volume local anesthetic infiltration in one hip and similar infiltration with saline (placebo) in the other hip.
DOC.brief_title: Local Infiltration Analgesia With Ropivacaine Versus Placebo in Bilateral Hip Arthroplasty
DOC.criteria: scheduled for bilateral total hip arthroplasty able to speak and understand Danish treatment with opioids or steroids
